result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Louis J. Stone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Judge allowing in patient treatment

11:10 a.m. Defendant Louis J. Stone in court, in custody, with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15CF1. Plea questionnaire and waiver filed/letter attached with agreed disposition. Schiek moves to dismiss but read in case 15CF197; granted.

2:19 p.m. Defendant Louis J. Stone in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Defendant Louis J. Stone in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf01 and 15cf197. Schiek statement - no agreement - joint request for 2 day jury trial - 48 hour notice for jury trial - motions in limine should be filed no later than October 28, 2015 - extraordinary motions to be filed earlier. If matter resolved - contact Court. Bail continued. Adj. 2:23 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Attorney Patrick Howard Finlan in court, defendant Louis J. Stone not in court, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:33
Written waiver of prelim filed-   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.
Information filed- In receipt, waive reading - not guilty plea - 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

3:33 p.m. Defendant Louis J. Stone in court, via video, in custody with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees states Attorney Patrick Finlan has been appointed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled unless Judicial Assistant hears from Attorney Finlan's office as to prelimin date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm. Adj. 3:35 p.m.
No contact with Christa Casey WHATSOEVER, no phone, email, texting, or 3rd party contact.

1:28 pm Defendant Louis J. Stone in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Court modifies sig bond in 15CF01 to $5,000 cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
